description: From Middle English incendiarie, from Old French incendiaire, from Latin incendiārius (“setting alight”), from incendium (“destructive fire”), from incendō (“I set on fire, kindle”), from in- (“into, in, on, upon”) + candeō (“I am hot”).

adjectives.description: incendiary (comparative more incendiary, superlative most incendiary)

entries.meaning: Capable of, or used for, or actually causing fire.
(figurative) Intentionally stirring up strife, riot, rebellion.

examples: Politics is an incendiary topic; it tends to cause fights to break out.

entries.meaning: Something capable of causing fire, particularly a weapon.
examples: The military used incendiaries to destroy the building. Fortunately, the fire didn't spread.

entries.meaning: (figurative) One who excites or inflames factions into quarrels.
